TEXT.English: Enter the user defined naming convention (see help file for further information). Names can be built from plain text and format codes that appear between matching carets (^).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]e.g. "^cv^ ^ut^ from ^ct^" --> "American Archer from Boston"[NEWLINE][BOLD]General Codes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]civ4[COLOR_REVERT] - Use built-in Civ4 names[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rd[COLOR_REVERT] - Random name[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rc[COLOR_REVERT] - Random civ-related name[NEWLINE][BOLD]Unit Info Codes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ct[COLOR_REVERT] - City where unit was built (e.g. Boston)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cv[COLOR_REVERT] - Civilization that built the unit in adjective form (e.g. American)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ut[COLOR_REVERT] - Unit type (e.g. Archer)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cb[COLOR_REVERT] - Combat type (e.g. Melee)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]dm[COLOR_REVERT] - Domain type (e.g. Water)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ld[COLOR_REVERT] - Leader that built the unit (e.g. Roosevelt)[NEWLINE][BOLD]Counting Codes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][a][COLOR_REVERT] - Count across all units[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][u][COLOR_REVERT] - Count per unit type[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][c][COLOR_REVERT] - Count per city[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][t][COLOR_REVERT] - Count per unit/city combination[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][b][COLOR_REVERT] - Count per combat type[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][d][COLOR_REVERT] - Count per domain[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]tt1[f][x:y][COLOR_REVERT] - Count up to a number chosen between x and y[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]tt1[f][x][COLOR_REVERT] - Count from x, incrementing each time tt1 code is reset[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]* f in [f] is one of s, A, a, p, g, n, o, r (see help file)
TEXT.Chinese: Enter the user defined naming convention (see help file for further information). Names can be built from plain text and format codes that appear between matching carets (^).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]e.g. "^cv^ ^ut^ from ^ct^" --> "American Archer from Boston"[NEWLINE][BOLD]General Codes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]civ4[COLOR_REVERT] - Use built-in Civ4 names[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rd[COLOR_REVERT] - Random name[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rc[COLOR_REVERT] - Random civ-related name[NEWLINE][BOLD]Unit Info Codes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ct[COLOR_REVERT] - City where unit was built (e.g. Boston)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cv[COLOR_REVERT] - Civilization that built the unit in adjective form (e.g. American)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ut[COLOR_REVERT] - Unit type (e.g. Archer)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cb[COLOR_REVERT] - Combat type (e.g. Melee)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]dm[COLOR_REVERT] - Domain type (e.g. Water)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ld[COLOR_REVERT] - Leader that built the unit (e.g. Roosevelt)[NEWLINE][BOLD]Counting Codes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][a][COLOR_REVERT] - Count across all units[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][u][COLOR_REVERT] - Count per unit type[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][c][COLOR_REVERT] - Count per city[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][t][COLOR_REVERT] - Count per unit/city combination[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][b][COLOR_REVERT] - Count per combat type[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cnt[f][d][COLOR_REVERT] - Count per domain[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]tt1[f][x:y][COLOR_REVERT] - Count up to a number chosen between x and y[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]tt1[f][x][COLOR_REVERT] - Count from x, incrementing each time tt1 code is reset[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]* f in [f] is one of s, A, a, p, g, n, o, r (see help file)

TEXT.English: When checked, the advanced naming conventions in 'Adv Unit Naming.ini' file will be used (see ini file for Era_UnitClass options).
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, the advanced naming conventions in 'Adv Unit Naming.ini' file will be used (see ini file for Era_UnitClass options).

TEXT.English: Enter the user defined naming convention for combat units 'SIEGE'.
TEXT.Chinese: Enter the user defined naming convention for combat units 'SIEGE'.

TEXT.English: When checked, uses the formats on this tab and in the INI file to name the player's units.
TEXT.Chinese: When checked, uses the formats on this tab and in the INI file to name the player's units.
